docs.abstract: Mr. Biden voted for a constitutional amendment to allow individual states to overturn Roe in 1982, then later voted against it. His back-and-forth over abortion has been a hallmark of his career.
docs.snippet: Mr. Biden voted for a constitutional amendment to allow individual states to overturn Roe in 1982, then later voted against it. His back-and-forth over abortion has been a hallmark of his career.
docs.lead_paragraph: It was a new era in Washington in 1981, and abortion rights activists were terrified.

headline.main: When Joe Biden Voted to Let States Overturn Roe v. Wade
headline.print_headline: Biden’s Background Has Colored His Shifting Record on Abortion

docs.abstract: Speaking at a fund-raiser for L.G.B.T. causes, Mr. Buttigieg warned that identity politics was corrosive and urged greater unity among historically oppressed groups.
docs.snippet: Speaking at a fund-raiser for L.G.B.T. causes, Mr. Buttigieg warned that identity politics was corrosive and urged greater unity among historically oppressed groups.
docs.lead_paragraph: LAS VEGAS — Pete Buttigieg, the mayor of South Bend, Ind., on Saturday directly confronted one of his biggest vulnerabilities as a contender for the Democratic presidential nomination: running as a white man who has led a life of relative privilege at a time when many in his party are eager for a woman or a minority candidate to become their next leader.

headline.main: Pete Buttigieg Confronts Race and Identity in Speech to Gay Group
headline.print_headline: Buttigieg Calls for Solidarity In the Face of Identity Politics

docs.abstract: Ms. Harris would force companies with 100 or more employees to show they were paying men and women equally for analogous work, penalizing those that didn’t.
docs.snippet: Ms. Harris would force companies with 100 or more employees to show they were paying men and women equally for analogous work, penalizing those that didn’t.
docs.lead_paragraph: Senator Kamala Harris of California on Monday announced a proposal to close the gender wage gap by requiring larger companies to certify that men and women are paid equally, in an effort to combat wage discrimination on a federal level.

headline.main: Kamala Harris Announces Plan to Close the Gender Pay Gap
headline.print_headline: Harris Offers Plan to Close Gap in Pay For Women

docs.abstract: Mr. Buttigieg’s firing of popular black police chief Darryl Boykins unleashed a blizzard of claims, counterclaims, lawsuits and anguish in the minority community.
docs.snippet: Mr. Buttigieg’s firing of popular black police chief Darryl Boykins unleashed a blizzard of claims, counterclaims, lawsuits and anguish in the minority community.
docs.lead_paragraph: SOUTH BEND, Ind. — Pete Buttigieg had been mayor just 13 weeks when he faced a leadership crisis.

headline.main: Pete Buttigieg Fired South Bend’s Black Police Chief. It Still Stings.
headline.print_headline: Buttigieg’s Firing of Black Chief Still Stings City

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Wiretapping and Other Eavesdropping Devices and Methods

byline.original: By Trip Gabriel and Alexander Burns

docs.abstract: In a new report, Democrats and Republicans denounced the “tough on crime” approach as unsparingly as they once promoted it.
docs.snippet: In a new report, Democrats and Republicans denounced the “tough on crime” approach as unsparingly as they once promoted it.
docs.lead_paragraph: One contributor to a new report on American criminal justice called the current system “an affront to our most fundamental values of freedom, equality and liberty,” then suggested sentencing fewer people to prison, sealing nonviolent criminal records and restoring voting rights for released offenders.

headline.main: Left and Right Agree on Criminal Justice: They Were Both Wrong Before
headline.print_headline: On This Issue, Both Sides  Concede They Were Wrong

docs.abstract: Ms. Warren, a Democratic presidential candidate, also said she would donate the funds she received from the Sacklers, who are behind OxyContin.
docs.snippet: Ms. Warren, a Democratic presidential candidate, also said she would donate the funds she received from the Sacklers, who are behind OxyContin.
docs.lead_paragraph: Senator Elizabeth Warren of Massachusetts escalated her criticism of the pharmaceutical industry, announcing she would donate the campaign contributions she has received from the family of the pharmaceutical magnate Raymond Sackler, and calling on Harvard University to remove the Sackler name from all campus buildings where it appears.

headline.main: Elizabeth Warren, Unveiling Opioid Plan, Says Sackler Name Should Come Off Harvard Buildings
headline.print_headline: Warren Will Give Away Sackler Donations

docs.abstract: As McDonald’s held its annual shareholder meeting on Thursday, several presidential candidates joined striking workers demanding a $15 minimum wage.
docs.snippet: As McDonald’s held its annual shareholder meeting on Thursday, several presidential candidates joined striking workers demanding a $15 minimum wage.
docs.lead_paragraph: As McDonald’s held its annual shareholder meeting on Thursday, several Democratic presidential candidates joined striking workers demanding a $15 minimum wage, union rights and better protection from sexual harassment.

headline.main: 2020 Democrats Join McDonald’s Workers Striking Over Wages and Harassment
headline.print_headline: Democrats Back Workers In Pressuring McDonald’s

docs.abstract: For Mr. Jones, the fight over the shutdown, in a state where President Trump is popular and many federal workers live, is a reminder that his party’s views are out of step back home.
docs.snippet: For Mr. Jones, the fight over the shutdown, in a state where President Trump is popular and many federal workers live, is a reminder that his party’s views are out of step back home.
docs.lead_paragraph: HUNTSVILLE, Ala. — After Doug Jones scored an upset win in the Alabama Senate race in 2017, elated Democrats nationwide dreamed of winning in other deeply red corners of the country. Mr. Jones seemed to offer a model, rejecting labels like progressive or conservative and calling himself a “Doug Jones Democrat.”

headline.main: Doug Jones Risks His Alabama Senate Seat Over the Shutdown and the Wall
headline.print_headline: Senator Digs In Against Wall, Risking the Wrath of Alabama

docs.abstract: As the presidential nominating contest narrows next year, there may not be room for two white men under 50 who present themselves as mainstream progressives.
docs.snippet: As the presidential nominating contest narrows next year, there may not be room for two white men under 50 who present themselves as mainstream progressives.
docs.lead_paragraph: NASHUA, N.H. — The question was the same: Why should you be the Democratic nominee for president?

headline.main: Pete Buttigieg and Beto O’Rourke Stake Out Similar Turf in a Crowded Field
headline.print_headline: Two Fresh Faces, Both White, Energize and Agonize Hungry Democrats

docs.abstract: Ms. Harris pledged to implement measures that have long failed to pass in Congress, including mandatory background checks and regulations on manufacturers.
docs.snippet: Ms. Harris pledged to implement measures that have long failed to pass in Congress, including mandatory background checks and regulations on manufacturers.
docs.lead_paragraph: Senator Kamala Harris of California, the former prosecutor who is running for the Democratic presidential nomination, on Monday committed to a host of executive actions to implement gun control measures that have long failed to pass in Congress.

headline.main: Kamala Harris Proposes Executive Orders on Gun Control
headline.print_headline: Harris Promises Orders on Gun Control
